sentences.english: Plus IDA's coldness, red fruits in the mind is very owe right now.
sentences.chinese: 加上艾達的冷言冷語，紅果心裏很欠好受。

sentences.english: Goldman=system, is a good summary of so many snide mutterings.
sentences.chinese: 高盛＝金融體系，這就是如此多冷言冷語的最佳概括。

sentences.english: And that cynicism has been the hallmark of the whole campaign against reform.
sentences.chinese: 這種冷言冷語一直是整個反對醫療改革運動的標誌。

sentences.english: In response to the parents’ cold stares and harsh words, he said only, “Is that so?”
sentences.chinese: 面對女子父母的冷言冷語，他只說了一句“是嗎？”

definition: variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
it's the most capable people who do the most work (idiom) (intended as consolation for the overworked, or flattery when making a request etc)
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
